headline: Your Poker Crew Just Got Bigger: Zynga Poker Launches on Steam
summary: SAN MATEO, Calif., August 15, 2025--Zynga Inc., a wholly-owned publishing label of Take-Two Interactive Software, Inc. (NASDAQ: TTWO) and a global leader in interactive entertainment, today announced that Zynga Poker, one of the largest and longest-running, free-to-play poker games, is now available to play on Steam with full crossplay functionality. content.title: Your Poker Crew Just Got Bigger: Zynga Poker Launches on Steam
content.summary: SAN MATEO, Calif., August 15, 2025--Zynga Inc., a wholly-owned publishing label of Take-Two Interactive Software, Inc. (NASDAQ: TTWO) and a global leader in interactive entertainment, today announced that Zynga Poker, one of the largest and longest-running, free-to-play poker games, is now available to play on Steam with full crossplay functionality. Launched in 2007 as Zynga’s first-ever game, the legendary title is raising the stakes as the label’s first game to launch on Steam. With one accou

thumbnail.caption: Zynga Inc., a wholly-owned publishing label of Take-Two Interactive Software, Inc. (NASDAQ: TTWO) and a global leader in interactive entertainment, today announced that Zynga Poker, one of the largest and longest-running, free-to-play poker games, is now available to play on Steam with full crossplay functionality. Launched in 2007 as Zynga’s first-ever game, the legendary title is raising the stakes as the label’s first game to launch on Steam. With one account, players can now move freely between mobile (iOS and Android), web browsers at zyngapoker.com, and now PC via Steam.

headline: 2 Safe-and-Steady Stocks for Long-Term Investors and 1 We Brush Off
summary: Stability is great, but low-volatility stocks may struggle to deliver market-beating returns over time as they sometimes underperform during bull markets.

content.title: 2 Safe-and-Steady Stocks for Long-Term Investors and 1 We Brush Off
content.summary: Stability is great, but low-volatility stocks may struggle to deliver market-beating returns over time as they sometimes underperform during bull markets.
